benchmark_details.name: KBENCH SYZ
benchmark_details.overview: KBENCH SYZ is a crash resolution benchmark drawn from real-world Linux kernel bugs, designed to evaluate large language models in resolving complex bugs in production-ready systems-level software.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To benchmark the efficacy of large language models in resolving Linux kernel bugs.

data.source: Collected from reported and fixed bugs on Syzbot using Syzkaller.
data.annotation: Data includes crash reports, reproducer files, and developer-written patches.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the percentage of successful patch applications and bug resolutions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher percentages indicate better model performance in generating valid patches and successfully resolving bugs.
methodology.baseline_results: Initial evaluations indicate a bug resolution rate of up to 5.38% under assisted conditions.
methodology.validation: Validation performed through benchmarking against state-of-the-art LLMs.

targeted_risks.harm: Potential consequences of incorrect bug resolutions leading to system instability.
